title.narrative: Enhancing the Capacity of the Shallot Sector in Dogon Country, Mali

description.narrative:
LWR will be collaborating closely with the Association for Women’s Promotion (YAGTU) and Jaabalé Badamo Tumo Union in a phase II project to confront shallot farmers’ lingering challenges in transforming their shallot production into a more economically viable and remunerative endeavor. LWR successfully implemented a similar phase I project with 4 women’s groups, which focused on imparting project participants with knowledge in skills related to management techniques, production technology and marketing of fresh and processed shallots. This phase II initiative will build on phase I project successes and lessons learned by increasing women producers’ revenues through agricultural infrastructure improvements and facilitating the Union’s access to commercial loans. This project will also focus on improving the organizational capacity of the Union and its member cooperatives through a series of organizational trainings.
Jaabalé Badamo Tumo Union was created in 2011 with the support of YAGTU at the end of the phase 1, improved shallot production project. Founded in 1997, YAGTU is an organization dedicated to enhancing women’s participation in local development processes. For the duration of this project, YAGTU will be playing a key supportive role in mentoring the Union in autonomous administration and management.
Objective #1: To facilitate a 35% increase in revenue for member of Jaabalé Badamo Tumo through reorganization and targeted support to weak links in the current shallot value chain, including the production, collection, processing and marketing of shallots.
Objective #2: To strengthen the institutional, organizational and technical capacities of Jaabalé Badamo Tumo Union and its 14 member cooperatives to ensure efficient and autonomous management of the shallot sector
